2012-Apr-16 13:45:29 by tstclair:
how far back does *this go? (release)

2012-Apr-16 15:10:24 by tstclair:
could you please ref the delta which caused this to vomit?

2012-Apr-17 10:38:43 by gthain:
The problem started when we started to push all dirty attributes of the job ad from the shadow to the schedd. In the PU, and only the PU, we mark the ATTR_JOB_STATUS as running at startup. This marked ATTR_JOB_STATUS as dirty, and JOB_STATUS was updated to the schedd during the next update.

However, when a job is put on hold by the tool, the schedd marks the job as held in it's copy, then tells the shadow to evict the job. The shadow doesn't know if the job is to be held or removed, it just gets job off the machine. Before the shadow exits, it updates the job ad, which reverts the ATTR_JOB_STATUS state back to running. Then, when the schedd's reaper is called, it doesn't know the job was held, so it removes it.

I haven't done git archeology, but I believe this was initially caused by the condor_suspend/resume code.
